values:
i don't know where to start this.

so it's one of the only two afternoons i have off all week.  the only two days i don't work doubles (i haven't had an entire day off without work since i had to go home for a week to visit the family at xmas).  and i usually use the time off to catch up on sleep but i was going to clean the disaster pit that is my room.  and not really desiring to do this i decided to procrastinate by checking my email.  in my inbox was an email from a friend that i hung out with this summer before he moved away saying that he had just unfriended me because i don't ever really email with him anymore.  and i don't and that's fair.  it just made me stop and think.  i'm not very good at keeping in touch with anyone.  and it's not that i don't think about them or that i don't care.  and i know everyone's really busy and has life rough.  and my way of dealing with being super busy happens to be coming home at the end of the night and falling asleep.  chances are extremely high that along the way i've forgotten to email/call people.  (not that i have anything much to say other than work bitching) which makes me a bad friend.  not because i don't care but because i don't care enough to give up one of my few hours off for sleep.  and i'm searching my playlists for a happy song to play but they just don't sound right to me right now.  there isn't going to be one that does.  i'm at a place in my life where if i stay here i'm not going to go anywhere with it.  and i know it and it's depressing me and frustrating me and that's manifesting itself in being mean to my friends and the girl i'm involved with, customers, and coworkers.  i'm not in school right now, i'm working a ridiculous amount of hours at a couple different jobs for not very much money to pay the bills and virtually no time off, i'm short on sleep/temper/stability/energy.  it's time to move on.  this will be my last year in ithaca, ny and come august 2007 i will be gone.  i am glad i came here but i've started to wear on my welcome and i can feel it.  ithaca is shrinking around me in opportunity and it's making me claustrophobic.  i need to start taking steps to get out of here.  so that i can get a degree, so that i can get a better paying job, so that i can actually have the time and energy to give to my friends.  so that one day they won't have to unfriend me.  because i do still love them.

this is NOT the way i recommend starting your week off:

open your eyes and see light.  (as an opener if i see light it means i've overslept.)  start to panic. shit shit shit. look at the clock...it's blinking 810. begin to really panic. check your cell phone. 811. holy fuck. start freaking out. you were supposed to be at work at 630. damnit damnit damnit. grab a sweatshirt and clutch it to your chest as you sprint downstairs in boy shorts to pound on your roommate's door. ask if there's any way you can have a ride? she can't get you there before 9. sprint back upstairs and check the time again. you have to leave right now and run to the bus stop to catch the bus but let's just say a shower is non-negotiable. keep panicking, realize you will most likely get fired. start to cry, call your co-worker half-way hysterical for advice, and jump in the shower. get out of the shower and reach for the black tie. if you're going to get axed you might as well look the part. have your co-worker call back and ask where you are because your boss just called him and asked him to come in. holy fuck. get to the cafe at 855 (almost 3 hours late!!) and rush through opening and making coffee while continuing to freak out and intermittantly tearing up. have an english breakfast tea and ponder whether you should call gimme today and see if they need another barista or wait until the axe falls.  happy fucking monday!

sick.  which automatically makes me whingy, bitchy, needy, and generally less than my better self.  frustrated with work right now too.  there was an incident at the pet store requiring a judgement call that i didn't actually make but supported the coworker who did.  it involved refusing to sell a bird to a group of people on the grounds that they wouldn't care for it correctly.  the group of people of course got extremely upset and made a scene and came back and eventually ended up purchasing the bird and the required supplies.  my boss at the pet store said he supported us at the time but was definately less than pleased with me over it.  i guess he felt i should know better how to handle things.  well, i guess i probably should i've been there long enough now.  but he said he was over it and not angry.  when a very similar situation arose this weekend involving an expensive animal and inappropriate conditions and i took a similar action, he was very quick to get sharp with me.  according to him we don't know that the conditions are actually unsuitable and we should give the people the benefit of the doubt.  even when in this situation (like the other one) the individuals involved clearly didn't give us any reason to give them any room for doubt.  at the cafe i feel like i have a basic working understanding of the how to make drinks part.  they're not the best drinks ever (one day...just give me time...) but for the most part i feel like maybe i can handle myself behind the bar.  after all i've been here almost 6 months.  and then the other day i spill my boss's latte foam, after having to pull an shot twice, and today i get a comment on how my co-workers have cool latte art.  granted, part of the problem is me, i have this whole "i want to be the best employee i want to be perfect i want my boss to like me and am always halfway convinced that my boss hates me" issue.  i know that.  but i also feel like i'm again too comfortable at work, too confident that i know what i'm doing/am doing enough.  and my response to that has always been to step it up and take on additional responsibilities or learn new things.  at the same time i feel like hey, give me a little credit for what i do do because i feel like i deserve it some credit for it.  although i suppose it's good for me to not be complacent...and i probably don't deserve anything i just think i do.
i hate it when i'm right about things i don't want to be right about.  at least i can trust my readings of a situation.

In the year 2006 I resolve to:
Get the chick next door pregnant.

http://resolution.geek-foo.net/

so i am home at my parents' house in madison, wi until the 29th of december.  except for about 6 hours more time spent in the phili airport (two of my flights got canceled) than i would have liked, break is going pretty well.  my days have been consisting of sleeping as late as i want, reading and knitting by the fire, playing with my cat matteo, getting some much needed thinking done, and being fed all manners of chicken and veggie dishes.  also smiling over text messages as one starting something new with another one is bound to do.  especially when the other one is thus far as genuinely sweet and thoughtful as she seems.  it is reminding me how to be that way myself again.  i am content.  i don't remember the last time i've felt this way but it is awesome and here's hoping i can bring it back to ithaca and into the new year.  :)  the crazy, dramatic, nothing-is-going-right depressed existence i've had for the past six months is over.

in the past three days i've:

--burnt my hand (in addition to the cracking & bleeding from being dry)
--spilled my only meal of the day all over the floor before i had a chance to eat it
--wrecked my favorite silver tie
--worked 31 hours
--gotten 10 total hours of sleep
--run into my ex and been a bitch
--gotten cancelled on my birthday dinner & the only celebration for it i was planning
--run out of laundry detergent on the only free night i had to do laundry
--fucked a final
--fought with my parents about coming home
--been "spoken to" by my boss
--been forced out of my barista position by another barista who has less experience than i do
--had customers be rude to me & a professor treat me like an idiot

so dear higher power, I CONCEDE DEFEAT.  please stop having it out for me now.  i will not again attempt to make fun plans, will accept that i am nothing but a college drop-out, will forget about my stupid birthday, stop looking forward to things, apply for another job, accept that my parents love my brother more, leave my friends alone and stop bitching to them, and whatever else i am supposed to do.  just please let me be.

i had a woman yell at me tonight at the cafe for not giving her enough "coffee" in her cappuccino.  to which i reply, "ma'am, a cappuccino is an espresso shot with milk foam and a little milk."  granted i did make it on the dry side.  and she's like, "well i just thought there would be more coffee in it, but then i've never ordered one here before."  good lord.  it's a cappuccino!
every year when it comes time for me to go home there's always a reason (named my brother) that prevents my parents from picking me up at the airport.  after we go back and forth fighting about my coming home.  as soon as they secure the "yes i'll come" from me they're done.  they conveniently forget that they have to pick me up at the airport.  and it always turns into well you know we love him more so you'll just have to sit at the airport and wait.  as if i have to give them a reason to choose him over me.  this year is to be no different.  says the message on my phone when i get off work tonight: "well your brother has a final on monday night so we're going down to get him and bring him home...what time does your flight get in again?  we might not be able to get you right away..."


"and I wonder where these dreams go 
when the world gets in your way
what's the point in all this screaming
no one's listening anyway"

maybe it's just the weather.  maybe it's just the holiday season.  i don't like the holidays.  i am not impressed with the fact that my hours at the cafe that i need are likely to get cut.  i'm not a bad barista but i can't compete 4 months with 2 years.  i really, really am not excited to have to quit and find another job again.  i am a creature that likes regularity in some aspects of my life and my schedule is definitely one of them.  i would prefer to be the employee that has been there forever and knows all the ropes to the new girl again.  i would rather stay at the cafe now that i have finally starting doing another job that i love than have to leave again.  but maybe that's just how my life is going to go.  friends and lovers and jobs and always the leaving.  maybe i am just supposed to be the restless creature that is always changing something or leaving or being left.  although i have never stayed in the same town as an ex before and i am not finding the experience pleasant.  the no school/what school/degree issue continues.  but i've been saying for the past 7 years that i want to be an engineer and without that i have no direction whatsoever.  i just feel lost.  in a short week i'm going to be sitting alone in a bar because everyone else is too busy with school to go out with me another year older with a martini in my hand and no degree.  and quite likely my ex and whoever she's moved on to and all her friends on the other end.  i hate my birthday.  in fact i hate days that are supposed to be special--birthdays, holidays, etc.  every year i have this vision in my head of how they will go and i get excited for them to happen.  and they always end up sucking.  feeling distant from friends.  dreading going home for the holidays for all the fighting with my family it will bring.  there's a reason i haven't been home in a year.  i don't have the energy or the desire to fight during my waking hours for eight days and spend two days flying all over the damn country just to do so.
got my tongue pierced.  happy birthday to me.  (the deuce-deuce in two weeks.)  ah'll be tahking wif a whisp for a few dayths.  but it will look cool once it stops being swollen.

11:11.  make a wish.  i wish that tonight a good friend didn't say that he didn't want to talk to me because all i am is depressing.  i wish that i could trust in people not to leave...that i wasn't afraid that they will.  that i know to everyone i meet there is an end.  that when i think of friends and friendships it would be with a sense of permanence.  that my belief in "the people you love can always leave" wasn't so strong.  and hadn't been so well reinforced.  (no, you weren't the first and you certainly won't be the last.)  so after he made the comment i resolved to not say anything depressing the rest of the night.  but how much does that leave me to talk about?  i am frustratedly amused by my bad luck and how it insists on persisting despite the "rabbit rabbit" on the first.  i'm just not superstitious, maybe that's why it didn't help.  i went through three groups of people before finding someone to feed me turkey on thanksgiving--i'm not feeling so popular.  my housemates hate me because i don't do my chores on time even though i'm never home to use anything in the house except the shower.  really i'm just their easy scapegoat.  i'm fighting with my parents about school/no school while struggling through double shifts.  12-15 hour work days and my life is just flying by.  that has always been my thing.  work enough and life narrows down to awakening to the alarm, getting to work on time, being as productive as possible to be a good employee, leaving before the sun rises and returning just hours before it will rise again, fall into bed for a few hours before repeating.  perhaps a dinner or a bar night mixed in.  it's autopilot.  healing.  survival.  a defense mechanism.  a no-thinking, no time for much of anything schedule.  no time for feeling anything except tired.  no inadequate feelings over school, no lack of direction, no loneliness/frustration/anger, no thoughts of the future (or thinking about life in general) beyond next week's schedule.  where do i have to be and when tomorrow morning?

RIP flash the mouse.

bob says it nicer that i would.  he also gives you credit for thinking of me at all.  which is more than i would do.  you're sorry...well, i'm sorry i didn't listen to everyone earlier.

"i'm walkin' down that long, lonesome road, babe
where i'm bound, i can't tell
but goodbye's too good a word, babe
so i'll just say fare thee well
i ain't sayin' you treated me unkind
you could have done better but I don't mind
you just kinda wasted my precious time
but don't think twice, it's all right."

so angry at you.  shaking i'm so angry and cold.  and at me.  and at her.  (is it her?  i guess it doesn't matter i don't want to ever see her again anyway.  i hope i never fucking do.)  i hate that my friends were right, that i really was just a convenience to you.  that it was really that easy for you.  i hate that i meant that little to you.  i cared about you.  it was my own stupid fault really thinking you gave a shit.  were you lying the whole time?  you lied about wanting me to come to your parents...why did you even bother to invite me at all if you were just going to tell me not to come?  why is it so fucking easy for you to leave?  is it me that it's easy to leave or did you never have any feelings for me?  i guess i don't want to know.  i don't want to see you right now to ask you anyway.

so our house had a party...and i invited all my friends.  and only two people came, one because i made her and one because she made him.  it makes me very hesitant to have a birthday party (22 in a month!)...feeling less than popular right now.  ended up picking fights with two people about whom i care deeply that didn't show.  fights that perhaps even flowers and apologies aren't enough to fix.  wondering if perhaps they aren't fixable because they weren't meant to be.  cursing the sagittarian hopefulness that keeps me hanging on when everyone sensible would have moved on.  am i just convenient?  still searching for an apartment for me and the felines (matteo michael and charles connor), and the rabbit (orion), and the mice (spike, flash, and frankie), and the fish.  sick--again.  school is going horrendously...a very less than stellar return from my time away.  leaves me wishing for the ease of TC3 and saying fuck school i'll just work or go to tech school for something.  screw nasa i was never cornell material anyway.  missed my marathon and missing the training, the powerful feeling that comes from running miles, swimming laps, and lifting weights.  not sure what i am thinking but i have the time and the cafe needs help so picking up opening shifts on mondays and tuesdays...here's hoping my shots keep pulling well and i master the art of foaming milk...or at least that i don't mess up too badly.

You Are 30 Years Old
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?

still raining, still unlucky, still stressed.  still working and barely passing classes although finally mastering the ability to foam milk.  add a rescued kitten, a little optimism, and several shots of vodka.  shake well and serve in sprite.

i guess it's officially autumn...the weather is cool and rainy.  the leaves are falling.  there's that extra nip in the wind and in the night.  it all just makes me sad.  and resigned at the same time.  my string of bad luck has been increasing over the past six months.  i am not excited for what it will continue to bring.  just sad.

::you knew this day would come::

--sleeping through class
--a woman threatening to kill her 6 kittens
--coworker drama
--issues with ordered checks not arriving
--a leaking fishtank
--the wrong room for a prelim & being 15 min late
--still sick

building character...building character...really i don't think it would interfere greatly with my development as a person if every little fucking thing didn't go wrong...in fact i'll settle for only being half a person if only half as many things go wrong...

signs perhaps you have been out of school too long and it wasn't worth you going back:

-not being able to remember how to integrate (or differentiate for that matter) 1/x , sinx, cosx,... insert basic mathematical expression here.

-not being able to convert any angle in degrees to radians, or even know what the angle given in radians is (pi/4??)

-not being able to produce the unit circle or any sine, cosine, or tangent values for basic angles

-trig identities?  not a chance. sin2x ha.

in essence...no longer having any of the basic facts that your 19 year old engineering classmates have at the tip of their just barely post-pubescent fingertips.  and not having a TA that speaks english as anything approaching a first language to help you.*

*(for those of you that don't know, i had a TA from india try to fail me just because i am a girl and since then have had a thing against non-american TA's.  i know this makes me a judgmental bitch.  i can't help it.)

our dog died today.  i had a dream this morning that mixed a bunch of people from my past together and i woke up in tears at 4 in the morning.  almost a thousand miles away our dog was at the exact same time having the seizure/stroke that would be the reason she was put down later that morning.  why am i never there when someone dies to say goodbye?  why do i always end up feeling guilty for living out here and lacking closure?

it's a month later...a month since i have mocked customers and recorded the little events that make my life mine.  i had seven stitches put in my finger courtesy of subway.  i have a new conch piercing courtesy of a goal i achieved.

school starts tomorrow.  it's been over a year since i have been at the institution for which i moved to ny.  i am nervous that i don't have what i need to finish my degree.  i am afraid that i do and don't believe it enough.  i am scared that i will be too "experienced" (and i use that term loosely) for my classmates and i am clearly not "experienced" enough for the real world.

i have an interview for another job tomorrow that i don't have time for but need the money from.

though a few of its members have moved further away, i have a group of people whom i love and gladly call my friends and an environment in which i feel comfortable.  but it's an environment that i can't stay in indefinitely...i can't continue to be a mall employee in dear ithaca all my life.

just the thoughts that are in my head.

undisputed customer of the day:  a woman comes through the sub line and orders a foot long tuna fish on wheat.  she asks for the nutrition information and she looks it over while i finish making her sandwich.  "31 grams of fat!"  she exclaims in shock, "i guess i'll have to find something else to eat after today that's too much."  i ask her if she wants anything else today...her reply?  "why yes i'd like 3 cookies with that."

unrelated...why are there so many kids and pregnant ladies running around the mall lately?  there were so many kids in the pet store tonight that my coworker and i were quite literally tripping over the little anklebiters.

who decided it was appropriate to give an unsuspecting significant other an animal as a gesture of love and affection?  who thought it was a good idea to saddle your loved one with the responsibility and care of a life that will quite likely last longer than your love affair?  and who thinks its fair to the poor animal who gets dumped at a shelter or on the side of the road and is left staring after you with eyes that say i still love you why don't you come back for me when you break up with the aforementioned significant other and don't want to care for the animal or don't want to be reminded of the person?  a customer came into the pet store tonight to buy his unsuspecting new girlfriend a kitten.  but he is not the...
customer of the day:  the woman who is keeping her cockatiel in a cage more appropriate for one tiny finch because, in a south carolina drawl, "i can't find a pretty bird cage and i don't want a cage in my house if its plain or ugly."

in other news...my semester off is officially over.  i'll be heading back to cornell to finish up my degree this fall.  :)

a woman comes up to the sub shop counter and orders a turkey sub.  when i ask her whether she wants lettuce, tomatoes, or onions on the sandwich she gets super annoyed and huffily says, "you mean i have to TELL you what i want on it?"
this is after the truck that has all of our frozen food in it is lost and all the sub shops in ithaca are calling each other trying to figure out where oh where the little lost semi can be?
and before the sketchy man comes into the pet store tonight and says, "what's up woman?  you're looking good tonight."

i got hit on the head by a heavy metal object tonight at work (it's been a long day) and a long weekend and with an important interview tomorrow, stupid customer stories are all i've got right now.

--"robodwarf":  the proposed name for a prospective pet gerbil
--"i wish my toad didn't eat so much, it's such a pain to have to feed him."
--"i want a lot of ALL the dressings you have on my sub."
--"well i need to know exactly what sex my kitten is, i mean he can't have a boy's name if he's a girl.  it's just not right."
--"defrost the freezer by turning it off and chipping at the ice with a screwdriver."

spent the day packing up all the non-essentials of my life.  the bookshelves are cleared, the majority of the drawers are empty.  i've moved back and forth across the country several times now, i'm not a stranger to moving.  i'm good at boxing up my stuff for another relocation and i thrive on new places and new people.  move across the country again?  well alright where are we going and when do we leave?  already ithaca feels too small, already places are haunted.  but it always catches me off guard.  those things i hang on to, that i continue to carry from place to place, that i tuck in the back of a drawer or in a box under my bed.  those pictures (those faces!), those tokens, those memories that rest quietly in the back of my mind for 364 days and then spring upon me when i disturb their slumber.

on the phone:
me:  "thank you for calling ---.  how may i help you?"
woman:  "are you a pet store?"
me:  "yes"
woman:  "do you sell live animals?"
me:  "umm what?"  (no we only sell dead ones it's more fun that way)
woman:  "do you sell live animals?  you know puppies, kittens, hamsters, gerbils..."
me:  "yes we sell kittens, hamsters, gerbils..."
woman:  "ok thanks.  bye."

in the store:
child, pointing his finger at me (didn't anyone teach him it was rude to point?): "boy or girl?"
mother of child:  "what?  where?"
child points at me again.
mother:  "well i don't know about you but she looks like a girl to me."

this woman and her daugther came into the store today and bought a male betta fish (aka siamese fighting fish) for their tank.  the daughter was maybe 4 or 5 and expressed concern for the fish's well being since it was in a bag of water.  the mother responded soothingly to her little girl, "he'll be ok honey, he's a boy."  WHAT?!?

"you may not see it when it's sticking to your skin
but we're better off for all that we let in."
-e. saliers

"if you can't see beyond the myth of isolation
and the miracle of daybreak doesn't move you anymore;
connect the points and see the constellations,
as the night comes down on the reservoir."
-a. ray

at the pet store tonight this woman and her two young, long-haired girls came up to the counter to purchase some supplies for their pets.  as i was ringing the mom out, her younger daughter stood by her side, tugging on her shirt and asking repeatedly, and with increasing volume, "mommy mommy is it a boy or a girl?  mommy is it a boy or a girl?"  to which her mother, by this time unable to look me in the face, mumbled with an embarrassed laugh, "it's a girl honey" and hurriedly left the store with her gender-conforming daughters in tow.

this is the second time a guy has come into the pet store with an "i have the dick so i make the rules" t-shirt and a woman on his arm.  i don't understand.  are they mass producing these shirts along with "ithaca is [insert adjective]"?  and who are these women that have such little self-respect that they will allow their boyfriends to be seen with them in public wearing something so degrading to women?

tonight i watched this family spend almost 45 minutes solid trying to determine which kitten their daughter wanted for her second birthday.  she's two here people, just buy her a kitten and give it to her.  she can't even say "kitten" yet and she's more interested in sam the parrot than the cats.  she won't know the difference.

i don't feel like the age that i actually am.  

my friends are all either a couple years older or a couple years younger.

monday night after grocery shopping i had one of my favorite meals planned out.  spinach pasta with butter and parmesan cheese and chicken.  ever so tasty.  my housemate moved out for good on saturday after living here for 3 years so the majority of the supplies and things in the house were hers.  not until that night did i realize just how many basics i lacked.  i went to cook the chicken...but lacked utensils to do so.  so i was like ok i'll just have pasta...except again no utensils, no colander, no [insert kitchen utensil here].  add no dishes or silverware to eat said dinner off of in the event that i had managed to cook it.  but i don't know how to cook.  so off to target for me to stock up on the basics.  it makes me feel very grown up to be picking out kitchen stuff and also very nervous.  i mean what do i want or need for kitchen stuff?  all the apartment essentials that i have had to deal with acquiring lately have made me aware of just how young i am and an inkling of how much growing up i still have to do.

on a totally random note, i just found out that the subshop that i work for doesn't have an anti-discrimination policy for sexual orientation or gender expression according to the handbook i just received.  hmmm.

one fun thing about working so much is the ample opportunities provided for things to go wrong and people to amuse me.

thing that went wrong:  so today at the subshop our hotbay that keeps all our hot food up to temperature decided to make electricity noises and stop working.  annoying.  so we call the repair man in the morning and he comes in to fix it.  he rigs up some wires since evidently we need new parts and all these sparks fly.  and he goes, well it's fixed for now but if sparks fly or it makes that noise again turn it off and don't use it.  fabulous.  so if i get electrocuted tomorrow we all know why.

amusing customer:  this woman came through the sub line and ordered a sub.  she said she was allergic to seafood and ordered a meatball sub.  but see above thing that went wrong of the day, our hotbay wasn't working.  so when my coworker went to put her meatballs in the microwave, so she wouldn't get sick from undercooked meat, she freaked out because she was terribly, horribly allergic to seafood and seafood might have touched the microwave!  we explained to her that seafood was never put in the microwave.  and she argued that someone might have touched seafood and then touched the microwave.  at which point i am thinking woman if you are so damn allergic don't eat at a fast food restaurant.  but we calm her down and she pays and leaves.  and returns not 5 minutes later with her sub inexplicably wrapped in napkins and wants a new sandwich because the meatballs taste "burnt" and the sub is too messy.  gee a sub dripping with marinara is messy?  so the manager appeases her by making her a new one and sending her on her grumpy way.

on a different note...what's with everyone getting engaged?  three different friends have told me that they're engaged within the last week or so.  hmmm feeling painfully single...

so i pulled a reverse jesus today at work (thanks for the phrase andy!).  instead of making bread to feed the masses i wrecked bread so the masses starved.  24 loaves of bread to be exact.  apparently if you open the oven door but don't take the bread out right away it flattens.  but if you take it out of the oven and put it into the rack sitting right next to the oven it's fine.  i am so confused i don't understand how that works?

the oddity of the day...a massive group of people sporting bright blue southern baptist t-shirts and jesus loves you stickers descended on subway for lunch.  they were on a mission trip from the middle of nowhere, missouri.  and they stopped at the pyramid mall in ny for lunch.  random.  i got the impression they would rather i had not been part of their lunching experience.

i was making my way home from a bbq late last night on foot, after, as i often do when i feel i need to assert myself as an independent woman (read be stubborn), insisting that i am a big girl and can walk home alone.  the walk from the bbq to my place is about thirty minutes, it was around 3am and so i was walking fairly briskly, my backpack over my shoulders, my boys' sandals slaps on the pavement echoing.  ahead of me there were two girls walking home from collegetown, talking loudly, and weaving slightly.  suddenly they heard me behind them, turned around and stared, became silent, walked a little faster, turned around and stared again, and then crossed the street to continue their walk home on the other side.  i couldn't believe it!  they were afraid of me?  these girls had several inches and several pounds on my 5'1" 110lb frame and there were two of them to the one of me.  earlier in the night a friend of mine had told me he thought for a long time that i was still in high school (hopefully because of my stature and not my maturity level...) but nonetheless perhaps the only thing intimidating about me is the sharpness of the spikes in my hair.  so why did they feel the need to cross the street?

in pet store news, a man came into the store yesterday and asked to see the rabbits.  i hand him one of our rabbits, a fuzzy ball with floppy ears and big feet.  he hefts the rabbit in his hands a little and says to the rabbit, "yeah, you're about the perfect size for eating."  and here my jaw drops as he proceeds to tell me that he is from missouri where they have a farm of approx 600 rabbits that they raise and sell for meat.  granted i am a carnivore and i sell animals to be fed to other animals on a daily basis but i couldn't help breathing a sigh of relief when the man returned the rabbit and made his way down the mall to continue his shopping.

so it is the height of kitten season (spay and neuter your cats people!) and a woman came in the other night to buy a kitten for her three-year-old daughter.  not quite 24 hours later she calls the pet store to ask if she can return the kitten because her daughter is abusing it and she is afraid for the kitten's safety.  so she returns the kitten.  your daughter is 3 woman!  teach her how to respect and take care of animals.  and how about people too while you are at it.  not impressed.

in other news the drama in my life is pretty much resolved and life is back to normal.  which is nice.  the gorge that i usually go swimming in is closed for the summer which does not amuse me because it is ridiculously hot and humid.  right now it is starting to storm.  lightning and cool breezes.  i love storms.

spent all day working in 4 inch heels (forgot my shoes) after a night of feeling awkward and unwelcome.  feeling like ithaca is suddenly too small.  at least the ridiculous antics of the incompetent customers are entertaining.

--"we have to come back when the porky-hog is awake"  (12 year old girl in reference to the hedgehog)
--::i have the dick, so i make the rules::  (t-shirt on a 20-something i wanted to kick out of the store)
--::i heart dick::  (t-shirt on a 14 year old girl jess wanted to kick out of the store)
--"do you have any minnows that turn into frogs?"  (woman on the phone)
--"do ferrets have bones? i mean they're so bendy."  (40-something woman)
--"you mean you have to THAW the frozen rats before you feed them to the snake?"  (late 20-something woman with a boa)

in other news, happy birthday to sarah juliet and b.

it's one of those late-night restless times where there is too much on my mind to sleep and too much on my mind to get anything done.  can't even settle on a playlist.  emotionally drained from the past two weeks.  deaths, illness, broken relationships, former flames, familial disputes, complications with school.  i want to know how everything is supposed to turn out so i know what i should do.  i hate this cynical mood.  i wish it would stop raining.

this has been the week from hell.

"If you wait for me then I'll come for you
Although I've traveled far
I always hold a place for you in my heart
If you think of me 
If you miss me once in awhile
Then I'll return to you
I'll return and fill that space in your heart
Remembering
Your touch
Your kiss
Your warm embrace
I'll find my way back to you
If you'll be waiting
If you dream of me like I dream of you
In a place that's warm and dark
In a place where I can feel the beating of your heart"

i don't know how he survived but the pacu is still alive!  missing a few scales here and there but still very much alive.  and my manager got a bucket to transport him in.  but i am not going near him to net him again.  his future owner is picking him up tomorrow.  when i am not working.

in other news i can swim six different strokes and a quarter mile.  :)  (i passed my swim test.)

i killed a fish tonight.  or will have killed a fish tomorrow as it was still alive, floating upside down, and fluttering its gills at 90mph when i left work tonight.  the fish's imminent death was preceded by a man, a nice early 50-something guy with a massive tank, coming into the store near close to pick up the red-bellied pacu he has had on hold for the past week or so.  the fish is about 8 inches long and 5 inches wide and jess guesses around 8 pounds.  not a tiny fish.  it is being held in a 20 gallon high in which it can barely turn around and the largest net available to me is about 6 inches long and 4 inches wide.  the net will barley fit into the largest bag to transport the fish.  clearly not a good situation.  so i net the fish and as i am lifting him out of the water he launches himself out of the net...and drops about 6.5 feet to smack on the tile floor.  where he proceeds to wiggle and flop around for about two minutes while i am freaking out and trying to get him into the bag.  with my hands.  after what seems like forever, the fish is back into the bag and the bag is floating in the tank.  the gentleman who wanted the fish was quite amused and thankfully very low-key about everything.  he left with the plan to call in the morning and inquire as to the pacu's condition, saying that he was not looking for the fish specifically and if it died, it was not a big deal.  thank god.  when the fish dies it will be the first creature that i have accidentally done in at the pet store in the almost 9 months that i have worked there.  granted it was probably coming to me eventually but traumatic nonetheless.

in other news, having broken my "no drinking until finals are over" rule, put in place partly to keep me out of trouble (i tend to be make-out friendly when drunk) and partly to teach myself some discipline and responsibility, i got quite drunk with my coworkers saturday night.  i had a blast dancing and remembered all the events of the night.  but now i am faced with the dilemma...having broken the rule, do i throw it out the window or attempt to salvage it for the next two weeks?

in a weird place tonight.

"anyway the wind blows,
it's all worth waiting for"

"i do my thing, and you do your thing. 
you are you and i am i. 
and if by chance we find each other, it's beautiful; 
if not, it can't be helped."

-frederick e. perls

thanks jeff.

so my life is still the crazy-business that i make it and it's been awhile since i've written.  i've decided that running and weights aren't enough to satisfy my marathon-training appetite and have added a half-hour of laps in the pool to the routine as well as a one-hour hilly training run on saturdays.  i think my body would hate me if i didn't get such a killer runner's high.  what else?  only about two weeks left of school for me and i am doing well.  should be on track to return to cornell in the fall.  i think i am ready and it is about time for me to get on with my education.  work has slowed down slightly in that i am only working 5 out of 7 days at the moment which gives me my days off to seek a second job so i can pay my rent this summer.  i don't know about this working for a living thing.  i do however recommend the ginger peach iced tea at borders with massive amounts of sugar water.  i was made especially happy the past two months by an amazing woman.  but what she needs is to be with herself right now and how can i say i care about someone if i don't do everything i can to see that her needs are met?  even if all i can do for her is to not distract her from her soul-searching though i will greatly miss her company.  so being on the sad side tonight i devote the rest of this entry to (mostly pet store related) events that have amused me lately.

--in reference to a guinea pig:  "oh look, mice!"
--again in reference to a guinea pig:  "oh look, hedgehogs!"
--in reference to clown fish:  "look (child's name)! there are nemo fish!  i wish they were saltwater fish.  oh but there are saltwater fish over there."
--to me as his daughter is holding a ball python:  "my ex-wife hates snakes.  she would be furious if i bought one for my daughter.  how much is that snake exactly?"
--my french prof from frosh year that i thought was a dyke making out with a man under the blooming cherry trees at sunset
--"no children" by the mountain goats (thanks to sarah juliet)
--my encouraging summer to come early by wearing shorts every day
--my goldfish with one blue eye and one yellow eye

i cannot seem to find the right words to give hope to the suicidal, convince the self-starver to eat, calm the manic, or ease the hurt and angry.  maybe at this point there are no more words that i can give them.  words have never really been my thing, i don't know what else to say.

so it's such a noteable event for me NOT to be passing out facedown in a textbook in full makeup and contacts still dressed from the day that i'm devoting space to it.  remember the whole i don't feel like i am close to anyone rant?  oh yeah that's because i'm so busy i don't have time to be close to anyone.  between full-time classes, marathon training, almost full-time work, and the queer club i leave my house at 7 or 8 in the morning and don't get home until 930 or 10 at night.  i have no idea what's going on in the lives of the people i would call my friends if i had time to talk to them and spend so much time commuting on the bus i might as well be dating my cd player since i listen to that more than anything else.  while i am very fond of my barristas, i think i see them as least as much as my roommate if not more.  speaking of roommate we've been getting along because we never see each other to get on each other's nerves.  i don't have time to get my hair cut, do my laundry, buy food, or even go to the bank to cash the checks that i am earning.  and i don't feel like i can tell my boss to lighten up on the hours because not only do i need the money badly, i know my co-workers have no more time than i do to pick up the slack.  so what do i do?  i spend my days moving from one thing to another and feeling incredibly busy and strangely alone all at the same time.

oh, and scratch that betta living thing as well...though i did take the time to feed him.

disclaimer:  no expectations of literary greatness please, i'm an engineering major and a pet store employee not an english major.

despite having an excellent semester academically, a successful start to training for the adirondack marathon, plenty of hours at the pet store, and a betta that has managed to outlive his four day guarantee, i can't help but feel like something is missing in my life.  despite being surrounded by a diverse group of people that i care about and that i would call "friends," i don't feel like i have a single "close" friend.  and thus at 2 in the morning instead of finishing my stats hw i'm pondering coming up on the "it's been a year since" mark for a series of difficult events in my life and finding myself as expected a year stronger but a year more distant from my companions.
